title: Oklahoma Route 66
features: Building on the foundation laid with the first edition of Oklahoma Route 66, this updated volume, in full color, contains many new images, color-coded maps, and everything you would expect from the top authority on the Mother Road in Oklahoma. With 62 maps and over 250 photos, it can be used simply as a guide to navigate the road or as a reference or handbook. Oklahoma Route 66 is the most thoroughly documented accounting of a section of Route 66 yet published.
description: Oklahoman Jim Ross has been a student of Route 66 for over two decades. As a researcher, photographer, writer, and preservationist, he has published dozens of articles on the complex alignments of the route and has lectured on its history and preservation. A recipient of the John Steinbeck Award and a member of the Oklahoma Route 66 Hall of Fame, he is also the co-author of Roadside U.S.A. and Route 66 Sightings.
